Class RandNumGame

java.lang.Object
RandNumGame
public class RandNumGame extends Object
A program that mimics a number guessing game. Uses the Random method from java.util.Random to create a randomly generated number generated based on time. This however also means that given time, a user may be able to deterministically ascertain the number.
Author:
Winston Tsia

      public static void welcome()

    • numCompare

      public static int[] numCompare(int numin1, int numin2, int[] array)
      A method that organizes 2 input numbers into a 3 element array as well as calculates the distance between the two, and returns the result as a filled 3 element array. If an invalid range is given, it outputs an empty array and a statement to 'try again'.
      Parameters:
      numin1 - first user input integer.
      numin2 - second user input integer.
      array - an empty array to store the compared values and calculation.
      Returns:
      array

    • oddsCalculator

      public static double oddsCalculator(double guesses, double range)
      Calculates the probability of guessing 5 unique numbers
      Parameters:
      guesses - an input guess limit.
      range - an input value that reflects the magnitude between two input numbers
      Returns:
      odds

    • introduction

      public static void introduction(int guessLimit, double guessOdds, int[] array)
      Prints an introductory statement with information relevant for the user, and queries for guess inputs.
      Parameters:
      guessLimit - limit of guesses set in the program.
      guessOdds - variable used to store odds.
      array - 3 element array to store range numbers and a calculated value.
